title: Ray Hancock
text:
Charles Raymond Hancock (16 February 1925 – 20 April 2007) was an <a href="English%20people">English</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a>. He was <a href="Ken%20Hancock">Ken Hancock</a>'s elder brother. He played for <a href="Port%20Vale%20F.C.">Port Vale</a> between 1948 and 1956, and later turned out for <a href="Northwich%20Victoria%20F.C.">Northwich Victoria</a>. He was Vale's regular custodian as the club finished second in the <a href="Football%20League%20Third%20Division%20North">Third Division North</a> in 1952–53.
Playing career.
Hancock played for Abbey Hulton United and <a href="Bury%20F.C.">Bury</a> before joining <a href="Port%20Vale%20F.C.">Port Vale</a> in May 1948. He made three <a href="Football%20League%20Third%20Division%20South">Third Division South</a> appearances in the <a href="1948%E2%80%9349%20Port%20Vale%20F.C.%20season">1948–49</a> campaign, but manager <a href="Gordon%20Hodgson">Gordon Hodgson</a> kept him behind <a href="George%20Heppell">George Heppell</a> and <a href="Ray%20King%20%28footballer%29">Ray King</a> in the first team pecking order. Hancock, now aged 27, was selected by manager <a href="Freddie%20Steele%20%28footballer%29">Freddie Steele</a> as the club's first team goalkeeper in the <a href="1952%E2%80%9353%20Port%20Vale%20F.C.%20season">1952–53</a> season, as Vale posted a second-place finish in the <a href="Football%20League%20Third%20Division%20North">Third Division North</a>. However, King regained his first team spot in the <a href="1953%E2%80%9354%20Port%20Vale%20F.C.%20season">1953–54</a> season, as Vale won the league title and reached the semi-finals of the <a href="FA%20Cup">FA Cup</a> – Hancock featured just once all season. He played one <a href="Football%20League%20Second%20Division">Second Division</a> game in <a href="1954%E2%80%9355%20Port%20Vale%20F.C.%20season">1954–55</a> and featured twice in <a href="1955%E2%80%9356%20Port%20Vale%20F.C.%20season">1955–56</a>. Having made 53 appearances in all competitions for the "Valiants" he departed <a href="Vale%20Park">Vale Park</a> when he was transferred to <a href="Northwich%20Victoria%20F.C.">Northwich Victoria</a> in the summer of 1956.
Personal life.
Hancock married wife Joan, a school<a href="teacher">teacher</a>, in 1949. He worked at Masons Textiles in <a href="Leek%2C%20Staffordshire">Leek, Staffordshire</a> for many years.
